intro: Oxymitra diadena var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran oxymitra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understoreys. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
